article.headline: La Salle 74, Dayton 71
article.story: PHILADELPHIA (AP) -- Steven Smith scored 19 of his 25 points in the second half and Jermaine Thomas had 17 as La Salle beat Dayton 74-71 on Saturday for its seventh straight win. Darnell Harris added 16 points for the Explorers (17-4, 9-4 Atlantic 10). The win assured La Salle of its first winning season in the A-10 since joining the conference in 1995-96. Brian Roberts had 24 points for Dayton (12-14, 4-8), including 21 in the second half. Warren Williams added 11 for the Flyers, who had defeated La Salle in the last 11 meetings. The Explorers led 34-33 at the half in a game which saw 20 lead changes -- including 15 after the break. A long 3-point turnaround shot by Smith as the shot clock expired gave the Explorers a 62-55 lead with 6:25 left in the game, and a jumper by Sherman Diaz made it 71-63 with four minutes to go. Roberts then scored eight of the game's next nine points, cutting the lead to 72-71, but Smith's two free throws at 1:28 ended the scoring. The Flyers had three chances to tie the score in the last 30 seconds, but could not convert.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).
